Small fragment or broken piece of something.
Refers to something coming loose and falling.

Means accurate, upright, or fair.
To put to the test; also a noun for exams.

Common New Zealand fur seal.
Used for emphasis: 'truly,' 'certainly.'

Generic for gastropods.

Used when a male refers to his sister.

english: To fall down, landslip; to devour quickly
description: Collapse or landslide; also gobbling food.
Voluntary gift, often in cultural exchange.
Branch of a tree or a stream of water.

Valued shellfish with colourful shell.

The native bat species of Aotearoa.

Highest-ranking chief in traditional Māori society.

Packed tight, no room left.
Repetitive or emphatic form of kohi (gather).

english: Puzzle, riddle; also to throw, cast
description: Can mean a problem to solve, or the act of throwing something.
The main ridgepole of a meeting house; also figuratively the backbone or main support.
Used for human or animal blood; carries connotations of life force.
A parting or dividing line; can also mean a part/section of something.

Loanword; used for a leader in sport, ship, or military contexts.

Refers to setting right, mending, or making corrections.

Refers to extent in time or space.

description: Means to put an accusation, or to place something horizontally.
